content: ribbed beanie materials sizes adult- approximately 52cm measured aroundhead dimensions finished length 22cm from crown to cuff crown length 6cm yarn any 8ply / dk weight yarn we used woolly 8ply 104m/50g quantity 2 balls or approx 160m needle 3 50mm circular needles 40cm for body ofhat and 80cm for magic loop gauge 24-26sts x 30rows to 10cm in rib pattern slightly stretched materials 6 stitch markers yarn needle for sewingup for links to some beginner friendly tutorials you can visit our website at https //makermakerstore com/pages/links-and-tutorials 1 designed by emily bolduan © maker maker 2022 pattern abbreviations using 40cm circular needles cast on 120sts k knit place a marker and join for working in the round p purl ribbing k2 p2 repeat to end pm place marker repeat this row until piece measures 18cm sm slip marker from cast on edge ssk slip slip knit a common decrease sts stitches crown shaping r1 row 1 setup 1 remove marker k1 replace marker only 1 stitch worked round round the starting marker should now sit between repeat section in brackets to end two knit stitches setup 2 work 20sts in pattern knitting or purling sts as they appear pm 6 times decrease round ssk work in pattern to marker sm 6 times 6sts decreased our website ismakermakerstore com repeat decrease round every round until 12sts remain and you can find our other free patterns on ravelry https //www ravelry com/patterns/sources/maker-ma ker-store/patterns happy making finishing cut yarn leaving a long tail of at least 15-20cm using a darning needle thread the tail through all 12 live stitches starting from the left needle slipping stitches off as you go then pull tightly to close and secure on the inside of the beanie now just weave in your ends and off you go 2 designed by emily bolduan © maker maker 2022
